['Fifth - The ordinal number representing the position after fourth in sequence.', 'Quintuple - Multiply by five or involve five times as much.', 'Quinquennial - Occurring every five years.', 'Quintessential - Representing the most perfect example of a class or category, often associated with "fifth essence" in alchemy.', 'Quintet - A group of five musicians performing together.', "Quince - The fruit produced by an apple-like tree, traditionally used for cider making and preserves; the word itself has roots related to 'five' as it was once thought there were 14 types of apples.", 'Fiver - A slang term referring to a five-dollar bill in some regions.', "Quadruplet (plural: quadruplets) - One of four offspring born at the same time, or a group of four that forms a set, often used metaphorically as 'a quartet' when speaking of numbers/groups of five and beyond.", 'Fifth wheel - A term for an auxiliary component; originally referring to the fifth-wheel device on semi-trailers, though sometimes it refers colloquially to anything additional or unnecessary.', "Quintessence - The most perfect expression or embodiment of a class or type; historically linked with the concept of 'fifth essence'.", 'Quinine - A medicinal compound extracted from the bark of cinchona trees, originally used to treat malaria and named after its use in quintuple dosage formulations.', "Quintessential - Represents a perfect example or embodiment; historically related to alchemy's 'fifth essence'.", 'Quinquennial (plural: quinquennia) - Taking place every five years, such as a publication that releases issues every five years.', "Quintessentialism - Philosophical concept concerning the existence of an ideal or perfect form; often associated with Plato's theory of forms and linked to the notion of 'fifth essence'.", 'Fiver (currency) - A slang term for a $5 bill, commonly used in some regions as part of colloquial language.', 'Quintet (plural: quintets) - Group or set consisting of five members; often related to music ensembles but also used broadly for groups/sets involving the number five.', 'Fifth-rate - Low quality or inferior in some aspects, possibly deriving from nautical terminology where ships were rated according to size and capability (first-rate being the best).', "Quintessence - The most perfect or purest expression of a class; historically linked with alchemy's concept of 'fifth essence'.", 'Quincunx (plural: quincunces) - A geometric pattern consisting of five points arranged in a cross, similar to the layout of five coins on a Roman coinage scale; ['Golden Eagle - While not exclusively found in the sea, golden eagles occasionally venture near coastlines and are known for their impressive hunting skills.', 'Bald Eagle - The national bird of the United States, bald eagles primarily inhabit areas near large bodies of water but also soar over open land and can be seen around lakes or rivers.', 'White-tailed Sea Eagle (Haliaeetus albicilla) - As their name suggests, this species is a sea eagle closely related to the more commonly known Bald Eagle', 'Osprey (Pandion haliaetus) - Commonly called "fish hawks," ospreys are aquatic birds that specialize in catching fish, making them sea eagles of sorts.', 'Peregrine Falcon (Falco peregrinus) - A fast-flying bird known for its incredible dives to strike prey, peregrines have been observed hunting over water bodies, including seas and oceans.', 'Arctic Gyrfalcon (Falco rusticolus) - An impressive species of falcon native to the cold northern regions that can be found around coasts during migration periods.', 'Grey Heron (Ardea cinerea) - While not a true eagle, grey herons are water birds with long legs and sharp talons adapted for hunting along shorelines and riverbanks.', 'White-bellied Sea Eagle (Haliaeetus leucogaster) - Native to the tropical regions of South Asia and Southeast Asia, this sea eagle species is known for its distinctive white belly patches.', "Bonelli's Eagle (Aquila fasciata) - A medium-sized raptor native to Europe and North Africa that occasionally hunts near coastlines.", 'Tawny Eagle (Aquila rapax) - Found in Sub-Saharan Africa, this species is a large eagle with a preference for habitats close to water sources.', "Steller's Sea Eagle (Haliaeetus pelagicus) - A sea eagle native to the northern Pacific region and known for its impressive size.", 'Chestnut-backed Gull (Larus ruficollis) - Not an actual "sea eagle" but a gull species with distinct chestnut plumage, it\'s found near coastlines and can be seen over water bodies.', 'Bonxie (Pelecanus philippensis) - A type of pelican commonly found in Africa that is adapted to hunting along the shorelines where fish are abundant.', 'Gannet (Morus bassanus) - These large seabirds, also known as boobies, have impressive diving abilities and primarily hunt for fish near coastal waters.', 'Cormorant (Phalacrocorax carbo) - A group of water birds that includes the Great Cormorant; they are skilled hunters around bodies of water.', "Osprey's Relative, Bald Eagle Vulture (Gymnogyps californianus) - This bald-headed vulture species inhabits regions in California and Mexico where it feeds on carrion but can occasionally be seen near coastal areas during migration.", 'Penguin (Spheniscidae family) - Not an eagle, yet these flightless birds are highly adapted to life around the seas, with a preference for fish as their main diet source.', 'Sea Hawk (Aegolius acadicus) - A type of owl native to North America that hunts small mammals and occasionally preys on birds near coastal areas.']

['Armor - A protective covering, often made from metal or other sturdy materials designed to shield against harm or injury.', 'Shield - A defensive weapon used in hand-to-hand combat and designed to protect an individual by absorbing or deflecting attacks.', 'Vestment - An outer garment worn as a symbol of office, authority, or rank that can also provide some protection depending on its material.', 'Carapace - The hard shell covering the body of various species of animals like turtles and crustaceans which serves to protect them from harm.', 'Helmet - A piece of personal protective equipment worn on the head, made typically out of metals or plastics designed to safeguard against impacts and injuries.', 'Scaffolding - In a construction context, temporary wooden or metal frames used as a support structure for workers when working at heights', 'Bulwark - A defensive wall or barrier designed to prevent attack and invasion from enemies; can also refer metapromatically to something that provides protection.', 'Guardrail - Safety feature installed along the edges of stairs, walkways, or other high places with a purpose of protecting individuals against falls or accidents.', 'Kevlar - A strong and lightweight synthetic fiber used in bulletproof vests and helmets due to its excellent protection properties.', 'Bumper - The part at the front, rear, or sides of a vehicle designed to absorb impact during collisions, thus protecting passengers and other objects from damage.', 'Cocoon - A protective structure created by spiders as an enclosure for their eggs, providing safety and security until they hatch.', 'Bubble wrap - A transparent plastic material with bubbles that can be used to protect fragile items during shipping or handling, preventing breakage.', 'Crash helmet - An item of personal protective equipment designed specifically for use in motorcycle and other similar activities to minimize head injuries during accidents.', 'Armored car - A heavily protected vehicle used by banks and armies to transport valuables or personnel, offering protection from potential harm.', 'Barrier - Something that serves as a physical obstruction preventing access, entry or movement;
